lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Interest rates on conventional mortgages bottomed out at about 9.08 pct in March and rose to about 10.7 pct in April, according to Stephen Roach, economist at Morgan Stanley.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "There should be another month or two of very weak new home sales but with interest rates stabilizing, sale of new homes should become more stable by mid-summer," said economist Lawrence Chimerine of Wharton Econometrics Inc.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The drop in May, to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 616,000 units, was the largest since January 1982, the Commerce Department said.
